properties.name: apiVersion
properties.description: The resource api version

properties.name: id
properties.description: The resource id

properties.name: location
properties.description: The supported Azure location where the key vault should be created.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The resource name

properties.name: properties
properties.description: Properties of the vault

properties.name: systemData
properties.description: System metadata for the key vault.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: The tags that will be assigned to the key vault.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The resource type

properties.name: applicationId
properties.description: Application ID of the client making request on behalf of a principal

properties.name: objectId
properties.description: The object ID of a user, service principal or security group in the Azure Active Directory tenant for the vault. The object ID must be unique for the list of access policies.

properties.name: permissions
properties.description: Permissions the identity has for keys, secrets and certificates.

properties.name: tenantId
properties.description: The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be used for authenticating requests to the key vault.

properties.name: value
properties.description: An IPv4 address range in CIDR notation, such as '124.56.78.91' (simple IP address) or '124.56.78.0/24' (all addresses that start with 124.56.78).

properties.name: bypass
properties.description: Tells what traffic can bypass network rules. This can be 'AzureServices' or 'None'.  If not specified the default is 'AzureServices'.

properties.name: defaultAction
properties.description: The default action when no rule from ipRules and from virtualNetworkRules match. This is only used after the bypass property has been evaluated.

properties.name: ipRules
properties.description: The list of IP address rules.

properties.name: virtualNetworkRules
properties.description: The list of virtual network rules.

properties.name: certificates
properties.type: all | get | list | delete | create | import | update | managecontacts | getissuers | listissuers | setissuers | deleteissuers | manageissuers | recover | purge | backup | restore | string[]
properties.description: Permissions to certificates

properties.name: keys
properties.type: all | encrypt | decrypt | wrapKey | unwrapKey | sign | verify | get | list | create | update | import | delete | backup | restore | recover | purge | release | rotate | getrotationpolicy | setrotationpolicy | string[]
properties.description: Permissions to keys

properties.name: secrets
properties.type: all | get | list | set | delete | backup | restore | recover | purge | string[]
properties.description: Permissions to secrets

properties.name: storage
properties.type: all | get | list | delete | set | update | regeneratekey | recover | purge | backup | restore | setsas | listsas | getsas | deletesas | string[]
properties.description: Permissions to storage accounts

properties.name: id
properties.description: Full identifier of the private endpoint resource.

properties.name: etag
properties.description: Modified whenever there is a change in the state of private endpoint connection.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Id of private endpoint connection.

properties.name: properties
properties.description: Private endpoint connection properties.

properties.name: privateEndpoint
properties.description: Properties of the private endpoint object.

properties.name: privateLinkServiceConnectionState
properties.description: Approval state of the private link connection.

properties.name: provisioningState
properties.type: Succeeded | Creating | Updating | Deleting | Failed | Disconnected | string
properties.description: Provisioning state of the private endpoint connection.

properties.name: actionsRequired
properties.description: A message indicating if changes on the service provider require any updates on the consumer.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The reason for approval or rejection.

properties.name: status
properties.description: Indicates whether the connection has been approved, rejected or removed by the key vault owner.

properties.name: family
properties.description: SKU family name

properties.name: name
properties.description: SKU name to specify whether the key vault is a standard vault or a premium vault.

properties.name: createdAt
properties.description: The timestamp of the key vault resource creation (UTC).

properties.name: createdBy
properties.description: The identity that created the key vault resource.

properties.name: createdByType
properties.description: The type of identity that created the key vault resource.

properties.name: lastModifiedAt
properties.description: The timestamp of the key vault resource last modification (UTC).

properties.name: lastModifiedBy
properties.description: The identity that last modified the key vault resource.

properties.name: lastModifiedByType
properties.description: The type of identity that last modified the key vault resource.

properties.name: accessPolicies
properties.description: An array of 0 to 1024 identities that have access to the key vault. All identities in the array must use the same tenant ID as the key vault's tenant ID. When `createMode` is set to `recover`, access policies are not required. Otherwise, access policies are required.

properties.name: createMode
properties.description: The vault's create mode to indicate whether the vault need to be recovered or not.

properties.name: enabledForDeployment
properties.description: Property to specify whether Azure Virtual Machines are permitted to retrieve certificates stored as secrets from the key vault.

properties.name: enabledForDiskEncryption
properties.description: Property to specify whether Azure Disk Encryption is permitted to retrieve secrets from the vault and unwrap keys.

properties.name: enabledForTemplateDeployment
properties.description: Property to specify whether Azure Resource Manager is permitted to retrieve secrets from the key vault.

properties.name: enablePurgeProtection
properties.description: Property specifying whether protection against purge is enabled for this vault. Setting this property to true activates protection against purge for this vault and its content - only the Key Vault service may initiate a hard, irrecoverable deletion. The setting is effective only if soft delete is also enabled. Enabling this functionality is irreversible - that is, the property does not accept false as its value.

properties.name: enableRbacAuthorization
properties.description: Property that controls how data actions are authorized. When true, the key vault will use Role Based Access Control (RBAC) for authorization of data actions, and the access policies specified in vault properties will be  ignored. When false, the key vault will use the access policies specified in vault properties, and any policy stored on Azure Resource Manager will be ignored. If null or not specified, the vault is created with the default value of false. Note that management actions are always authorized with RBAC.

properties.name: enableSoftDelete
properties.description: Property to specify whether the 'soft delete' functionality is enabled for this key vault. If it's not set to any value(true or false) when creating new key vault, it will be set to true by default. Once set to true, it cannot be reverted to false.

properties.name: hsmPoolResourceId
properties.description: The resource id of HSM Pool.

properties.name: networkAcls
properties.description: Rules governing the accessibility of the key vault from specific network locations.

properties.name: privateEndpointConnections
properties.description: List of private endpoint connections associated with the key vault.

properties.name: provisioningState
properties.description: Provisioning state of the vault.

properties.name: publicNetworkAccess
properties.description: Property to specify whether the vault will accept traffic from public internet. If set to 'disabled' all traffic except private endpoint traffic and that that originates from trusted services will be blocked. This will override the set firewall rules, meaning that even if the firewall rules are present we will not honor the rules.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: SKU details

properties.name: softDeleteRetentionInDays
properties.description: softDelete data retention days. It accepts >=7 and <=90.

properties.name: tenantId
properties.description: The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be used for authenticating requests to the key vault.

properties.name: vaultUri
properties.description: The URI of the vault for performing operations on keys and secrets.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Full resource id of a vnet subnet, such as '/subscriptions/subid/resourceGroups/rg1/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/test-vnet/subnets/subnet1'.

properties.name: ignoreMissingVnetServiceEndpoint
properties.description: Property to specify whether NRP will ignore the check if parent subnet has serviceEndpoints configured.
